news_header: Yoon Suk Yeol, South Korea's impeached president, faces trial for insurrection charges amid high security.
news_original_title: South Korea: President Yoon faces criminal trial
news_text: South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol appeared in court for his criminal trial over insurrection charges, becoming the first president to do so. Yoon imposed martial law briefly, leading to his impeachment. Prosecutors accuse him of being the 'ringleader of an insurrection.' His lawyers argue for more time to review records. Yoon denies wrongdoing, claiming his actions were legitimate.
